Professional
Project 04

DealersArabia

Laravel, Jquery, Jira, Postman, GitHub

DealersArabia is a car selling website that I contributed to, built in Laravel. The website provides a user-friendly platform for individuals and dealerships to sell new and used cars. One of my primary contributions to the website was the development of a sophisticated filter system for the cars, allowing users to search for vehicles based on specific criteria such as make, model, year, and price range. Additionally, the website was designed with support for two languages, English and Arabic, to cater to a wider audience. I was responsible for creating the website from scratch, ensuring that it was optimized for performance, responsive, and visually appealing. Throughout my work on DealersArabia, I collaborated with a team of developers and designers to create a seamless user experience, providing a platform that was both functional and aesthetically pleasing. The result was a fully functional, feature-rich car selling website that provided a valuable service to buyers and sellers alike.

Academic
Project 05

Smart Waste Tracking System

Python, YOLOV3, Flutter, GitHub

I built a smart waste detector using Flutter and YOLOv3. The detector encourages recycling by making it fun and engaging through gamification. It uses a camera to capture the waste item and YOLOv3 to determine the type of waste. The user is then prompted to dispose of the item in the appropriate bin and earns points for doing so correctly. I designed the user interface to be easy to use and integrated cutting-edge technology to make the project more effective. Overall, the smart waste detector is an innovative solution that promotes recycling and makes a positive impact on the environment.

Academic
Project 06

Smart Weapon Detector

Python, YOLOV3

A research based project where my team and I developed a YOLO based weapon detector which was then compared to the state of art models. The dataset was created by collecting images of weapons and annotating them through a tool. Different type of models were tested and applied, YOLO performed the best out of all.

Academic
Project 07

Ludo Board Game

Java, JavaFx

A very popular board game in my home country "Ludo", is created in Java for desktop. The game is built through perfecting the UI of the ludo board and then the rules of the game were implemented in the game. It was an academic project during my bachelors and it was awarded the best project by the instructor of that course.

Academic
Project 08

CPU Scheduling Algorithms

C++

CPU scheduling algorithms were implemented in C++. There are different types of CPU scheduling algorithms and all have there own way of handling processes. I implemented the algorithms in C++ to visualize how these algorithms will work, this project was part of my course on Operating Systems.
